places.name: Lumbini (Birthplace of Buddha)
places.description: UNESCO World Heritage Site marking the birthplace of Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha) in 623 BCE.
places.detail: The sacred garden complex contains the Mayadevi Temple marking the exact birth spot, ancient monasteries from Buddhist nations, and the peaceful Lumbini Crane Sanctuary. The site attracts pilgrims and scholars worldwide.

details.subtitle: Discovery
details.text: Identified by Indian archaeologist General Khadga Samsher Rana in 1896 using Ashoka's pillar

details.subtitle: UNESCO Listing
details.text: Designated in 1997 for its universal spiritual significance

details.subtitle: Pilgrimage Tourism
details.text: Receives over 1 million visitors annually from Buddhist countries

details.subtitle: Interfaith Symbol
details.text: Master Plan developed by Kenzo Tange promotes peace through architecture

travelTips: Visit at dawn for serene atmosphere

places.name: Bardia National Park
places.description: Largest undisturbed wilderness in Nepal's Terai with thriving Bengal tiger population.
places.detail: Covering 968 sq km, Bardia offers pristine sal forests, grasslands, and the Karnali River ecosystem. The park has over 250 bird species and is known for elephant-back safaris to spot rhinos and tigers.

details.subtitle: Establishment
details.text: Created as Royal Hunting Reserve in 1969, upgraded to national park in 1988

details.subtitle: Conservation Success
details.text: Rhino population grew from 67 (1994) to over 250 today

details.subtitle: Wildlife Research
details.text: Important site for tiger conservation studies

details.subtitle: Community Involvement
details.text: Tharu homestays provide sustainable tourism model

travelTips: Stay at least 3 nights for best wildlife viewing

places.name: Kapilvastu (Ancient Shakya Kingdom)
places.description: Archaeological site of Buddha's childhood palace and capital of Shakya kingdom.
places.detail: The ruins spread across Nepal-India border include palace foundations, stupas, and monasteries dating to 6th century BCE. Tilaurakot in Nepal and Piprahwa in India both claim to be the historic Kapilvastu.

details.subtitle: Buddha's Connection
details.text: Prince Siddhartha lived here until age 29 before renouncing royalty

details.subtitle: Archaeological Finds
details.text: Excavations revealed ancient city planning and artifacts

details.subtitle: Pilgrimage Route
details.text: Part of Buddhist circuit connecting Lumbini and Kushinagar

details.subtitle: Research Site
details.text: Ongoing excavations by international teams

travelTips: Hire local guide for historical context
Visit early morning to avoid heat

places.name: Devdaha (Maternal Home of Mayadevi)
places.description: Ancient town associated with Buddha's maternal family, the Koliya clan.
places.detail: This archaeological site features ruins dating to Buddha's time, including potential remains of Queen Mayadevi's palace. The area holds importance as Buddha visited here after enlightenment.

details.subtitle: Royal Connection
details.text: Was capital of Koliya kingdom, Buddha's maternal homeland

details.subtitle: Buddhist Texts
details.text: Mentioned in Pali scriptures as place Buddha delivered teachings

details.subtitle: Pilgrimage Site
details.text: Growing interest among Buddhist pilgrims

details.subtitle: Archaeological Potential
details.text: Only partially excavated with many undiscovered ruins

places.name: Banke National Park
places.description: Biodiversity hotspot connecting Bardia and Katarniaghat wildlife sanctuaries.
places.detail: Established in 2010, this 550 sq km park protects critical tiger habitat along the Nepal-India border. The park features mixed hardwood forests and is part of the Terai Arc Landscape.

details.subtitle: Ecological Corridor
details.text: Historically part of wildlife migration route between Nepal and India

details.subtitle: Recent Protection
details.text: Gazetted as national park after community forests demonstrated conservation success

details.subtitle: Tiger Conservation
details.text: Part of global TX2 initiative to double wild tiger numbers

details.subtitle: Climate Resilience
details.text: Protects critical watersheds for local communities

travelTips: Visit Khata corridor for wildlife crossings
Morning drives best for animal sightings

places.name: Taulihawa (Ancient Tilaurakot)
places.description: Gateway to Kapilvastu archaeological zone with important Buddhist monuments.
places.detail: This market town serves as base for exploring Tilaurakot ruins. Nearby sites include Kudan stupa (where Buddha met his family after enlightenment) and seasonal Gotihawa pilgrimage site.

details.subtitle: Ancient Capital
details.text: Identified by some scholars as site of historic Kapilvastu

details.subtitle: Ashokan Legacy
details.text: Area contains several pillars and stupas from 3rd century BCE

details.subtitle: Archaeological Hub
details.text: Center for Kapilvastu region excavations

details.subtitle: Pilgrimage Stop
details.text: Growing infrastructure for Buddhist tourists

travelTips: Visit museum before ruins for context
Try local Newari cuisine in town

places.name: Dang Valley
places.description: Expansive valley with Tharu culture and important Hindu pilgrimage sites.
places.detail: Nepal's largest valley in the Inner Terai region combines cultural heritage with natural beauty. The area is known for Shiva temples, Rapti River, and annual festivals drawing thousands.

details.subtitle: Ancient Trade Route
details.text: Connected Himalayan kingdoms with Indian plains

details.subtitle: Shiva Worship
details.text: Temples date back to medieval Khasa kingdom period

details.subtitle: Agricultural Heartland
details.text: Major rice and maize producer for Nepal

details.subtitle: Cultural Tourism
details.text: Tharu homestays and festival experiences

travelTips: Combine with Bardia National Park visit

places.name: Ramgram Stupa
places.description: Only surviving original stupa containing relics of Buddha.
places.detail: This 6m-high stupa near Parasi contains ashes from Buddha's funeral pyre that avoided redistribution by Emperor Ashoka. The site remains spiritually powerful yet undeveloped for tourism.

details.subtitle: Funeral Relics
details.text: Contains portion of original relics from Buddha's cremation

details.subtitle: Ashokan Legend
details.text: Local naga spirits reportedly prevented Ashoka from taking relics

details.subtitle: Archaeological Treasure
details.text: UNESCO tentative list site since 1996

details.subtitle: Pilgrimage Potential
details.text: Developing as important Buddhist circuit stop

travelTips: Respect local customs (no climbing on stupa)

places.name: Sainamaina
places.description: Historic town with British-era architecture and religious sites.
places.detail: Founded as retirement colony for British Gurkha soldiers, Sainamaina features colonial bungalows alongside Hindu and Buddhist temples. The area offers insights into Nepal's military history.

details.subtitle: British Connection
details.text: Established in 1857 for retired Gurkha soldiers

details.subtitle: Military Heritage
details.text: Home to families with generations of Gurkha service

details.subtitle: Cultural Fusion
details.text: Blend of Nepali and British architectural influences

details.subtitle: Pilgrimage Site
details.text: Important Ram temple attracts devotees

travelTips: Learn Gurkha history at local museum

places.name: Chitwan National Park
places.description: Nepal's first national park and UNESCO site renowned for wildlife safaris.
places.detail: Though primarily in Province 3, the park extends into Province 5 with excellent access from Sauraha. The 952 sq km park protects Bengal tigers, one-horned rhinos, and over 500 bird species.

details.subtitle: Establishment
details.text: Created in 1973, became UNESCO site in 1984

details.subtitle: Conservation Success
details.text: Rhino population grew from 100 (1960s) to over 600 today

details.subtitle: Eco-Tourism Model
details.text: Pioneered community-based anti-poaching programs

details.subtitle: Research Hub
details.text: Important site for tiger and rhino conservation studies

travelTips: Stay minimum 2 nights for full experience
Morning canoe rides best for birdwatching
